               </span>
               <div class="x-text x-content e2-e19 m2-3n m2-3o m2-3p m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t">
                Prof. Dr.-Ing. Wofgang Kunz, EMECS General Coordinator
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="x-cell e2-e20 m2-1o m2-1t m2-1w m2-1y m2-1z m2-20 m2-23">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e2-e21 m2-2h m2-2i m2-2l m2-2m m2-2n m2-2o m2-2p m2-2q m2-2r m2-2s">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Welcome to our website!
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e2-e22 m2-3o m2-3p m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t m2-3u m2-3v">
                <p>
                 You have earned a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related discipline?
                 <span lang="EN-US">
                  If your ambition is to deepen your expertise and to enhance your career oppor­tunities in the vibrant field of Embedded Systems, then you are at the right place. Please take a look at the EMECS course.
                 </span>
                </p>
                <p>
                 The European Masters programme in Embedded Computing Systems (EMECS) is a two-years Master’s course where each of the two academic years is spent at a different EMECS partner university. The partner universities of our consortium are RPTU Kaisers­lautern-Landau, University of Southampton, Politecnico Di Torino and Norwegian University of Science and Technology.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Our partner universities are leading European research institutions in this field, offering excellent teaching quality and a broad spectrum of study modules to choose from. Additionally, the student mobility between partner universities provides a rich international experience that is vital in a globalized economy.
                </p>
                <p>
                 We are looking forward to your application!
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>

                  <span class="x-anchor-text-primary">
                   apply now
                  </span>

         <div class="x-section e2-e81 m2-0 m2-2 m2-3 m2-5">

           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e2-e83 m2-12 m2-13 m2-14 m2-15 m2-16">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e2-e84 m2-2h m2-2i m2-2j m2-2l m2-2m m2-2n m2-2r m2-2s m2-2v m2-2x m2-32">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Alumni Highlights
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e2-e85 m2-d m2-e m2-f m2-i m2-l m2-p m2-y">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e2-e86 m2-12 m2-13 m2-14">
             <div class="x-div e2-e87 m2-4g m2-4h m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o">
              <div class="x-text x-content e2-e88 m2-3o m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-40 m2-41">
               EMECS was fun and challenging. Most of my classes involved hands-on projects. We got full support from our professors in order to get the most out of this programme. Apart from certain mandatory classes, the programme was flexible enough to lead my studies to the direction I wanted. I had the chance to study with the  most qualified students from all over the world and had exposure to the academic studies and to the industry in countries that are  world-leading in technology.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e2-e89 m2-4b m2-4f m2-4g m2-4j m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o m2-4p">
              <span class="x-image e2-e90 m2-34 m2-37 m2-3a m2-3d m2-3k m2-3l">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="167" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/mine-e1624878250241.png" width="167"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e2-e91 m2-4g m2-4h m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e2-e92 m2-2g m2-2h m2-2i m2-2k m2-2m m2-2q m2-2w m2-30 m2-33">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Mine Erciyas
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e2-e93 m2-3o m2-3p m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-3x m2-42">
                <p>
                 Country: Turkey
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2010 – 2012
                 <br/>
                 Mobility NTNU and UoS
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e2-e94 m2-12 m2-13 m2-14">
             <div class="x-div e2-e95 m2-4g m2-4h m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o">
              <div class="x-text x-content e2-e96 m2-3o m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-40 m2-43">
               EMECS provided a very rich international experience that served as a door-opener for future career possibilities and an eye-opener for personal growth. Had a very colourful time with EMECS, highly recommend it.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e2-e97 m2-4b m2-4f m2-4g m2-4j m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o m2-4p">
              <span class="x-image e2-e98 m2-34 m2-37 m2-3a m2-3d m2-3k m2-3m">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="400" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/paulius_morkunas.jpg" width="400"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e2-e99 m2-4g m2-4h m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e2-e100 m2-2g m2-2h m2-2i m2-2k m2-2m m2-2q m2-2w m2-30 m2-33">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Paulius Morkūnas
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e2-e101 m2-3o m2-3p m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-3x m2-42">
                <p>
                 Country: Lithuania
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2016 – 2018
                 <br/>
                 Mobility UoS and TUK
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e2-e102 m2-12 m2-13 m2-14">
             <div class="x-div e2-e103 m2-4g m2-4h m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o">
              <div class="x-text x-content e2-e104 m2-3o m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-40 m2-44">
               I chose to apply for the EMECS program both to get quality education in my chosen field of embedded systems and to gain exposure to an international environment and EMECS did not let me down in either regard. The technical knowledge, social experiences and intercultural insight I gained during my stay in Southampton and Kaiserslautern have already proven invaluable a number of times. Having completed the EMECS program, I believe I am now well prepared for any future challenges I may encounter in my field of work.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e2-e105 m2-4b m2-4f m2-4g m2-4j m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o m2-4p">
              <span class="x-image e2-e106 m2-34 m2-37 m2-3a m2-3d m2-3k m2-3l">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="400" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/stian_gerlach_sorensen.jpg" width="400"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e2-e107 m2-4g m2-4h m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e2-e108 m2-2g m2-2h m2-2i m2-2k m2-2m m2-2q m2-2w m2-30 m2-33">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Stian Gerlach Sørensen
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e2-e109 m2-3o m2-3p m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-3x m2-42">
                <p>
                 Country: Norway
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2016 – 2018
                 <br/>
                 Mobility UoS and TUK
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e2-e110 m2-12 m2-13 m2-14">
             <div class="x-div e2-e111 m2-4g m2-4h m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o">
              <div class="x-text x-content e2-e112 m2-3o m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-40 m2-45">
               Applying for the EMECS program was one of the best decisions in my life! After finishing my bachelor's degree I wanted to specialize in Embedded Systems. Through the EMECS program I had the opportunity to study two years abroad, at two leading European universities. This allowed me to greatly extend my knowledge about Embedded Systems and at the same time to become friends with students from all around the world. This program opened up many possibilities for my future career and let me get to know lots of great people.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e2-e113 m2-4b m2-4f m2-4g m2-4j m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o m2-4p">
              <span class="x-image e2-e114 m2-34 m2-37 m2-3a m2-3d m2-3k m2-3l">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="167" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/tobias-e1624873403617.png" width="167"/>

               </span>
               <div class="x-text x-content e2-e19 m2-3n m2-3o m2-3p m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t">
                Prof. Dr.-Ing. Wofgang Kunz, EMECS General Coordinator
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="x-cell e2-e20 m2-1o m2-1t m2-1w m2-1y m2-1z m2-20 m2-23">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e2-e21 m2-2h m2-2i m2-2l m2-2m m2-2n m2-2o m2-2p m2-2q m2-2r m2-2s">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Welcome to our website!
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e2-e22 m2-3o m2-3p m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t m2-3u m2-3v">
                <p>
                 You have earned a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related discipline?
                 <span lang="EN-US">
                  If your ambition is to deepen your expertise and to enhance your career oppor­tunities in the vibrant field of Embedded Systems, then you are at the right place. Please take a look at the EMECS course.
                 </span>
                </p>
                <p>
                 The European Masters programme in Embedded Computing Systems (EMECS) is a two-years Master’s course where each of the two academic years is spent at a different EMECS partner university. The partner universities of our consortium are RPTU Kaisers­lautern-Landau, University of Southampton, Politecnico Di Torino and Norwegian University of Science and Technology.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Our partner universities are leading European research institutions in this field, offering excellent teaching quality and a broad spectrum of study modules to choose from. Additionally, the student mobility between partner universities provides a rich international experience that is vital in a globalized economy.
                </p>
                <p>
                 We are looking forward to your application!
                </p>
               </div>

          <div class="x-row x-container max width e2-e85 m2-d m2-e m2-f m2-i m2-l m2-p m2-y">

              <div class="x-text x-content e2-e88 m2-3o m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-40 m2-41">
               EMECS was fun and challenging. Most of my classes involved hands-on projects. We got full support from our professors in order to get the most out of this programme. Apart from certain mandatory classes, the programme was flexible enough to lead my studies to the direction I wanted. I had the chance to study with the  most qualified students from all over the world and had exposure to the academic studies and to the industry in countries that are  world-leading in technology.
              </div>
             </div>

               EMECS provided a very rich international experience that served as a door-opener for future career possibilities and an eye-opener for personal growth. Had a very colourful time with EMECS, highly recommend it.
              </div>

            <div class="x-col e2-e102 m2-12 m2-13 m2-14">

              <div class="x-text x-content e2-e104 m2-3o m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-40 m2-44">
               I chose to apply for the EMECS program both to get quality education in my chosen field of embedded systems and to gain exposure to an international environment and EMECS did not let me down in either regard. The technical knowledge, social experiences and intercultural insight I gained during my stay in Southampton and Kaiserslautern have already proven invaluable a number of times. Having completed the EMECS program, I believe I am now well prepared for any future challenges I may encounter in my field of work.
              </div>

                 <br/>

                </p>

            <div class="x-col e2-e110 m2-12 m2-13 m2-14">
             <div class="x-div e2-e111 m2-4g m2-4h m2-4l m2-4n m2-4o">
              <div class="x-text x-content e2-e112 m2-3o m2-3q m2-3r m2-3s m2-3t m2-3w m2-40 m2-45">
               Applying for the EMECS program was one of the best decisions in my life! After finishing my bachelor's degree I wanted to specialize in Embedded Systems. Through the EMECS program I had the opportunity to study two years abroad, at two leading European universities. This allowed me to greatly extend my knowledge about Embedded Systems and at the same time to become friends with students from all around the world. This program opened up many possibilities for my future career and let me get to know lots of great people.
              </div>

     <article class="post-41 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail" id="post-41">
      <div class="entry-wrap">
       <div class="entry-content content">
        <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
         <div class="x-section e41-e1 m15-0 m15-1 m15-2 m15-3" id="requirements">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e41-e2 m15-a m15-b m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-f m15-g m15-h m15-q m15-r">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e41-e3 m15-1p m15-1q m15-1r m15-1s m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e4 m15-1z m15-20 m15-21 m15-22">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Admission requirements
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e41-e5 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-f m15-g m15-h m15-i m15-j m15-k m15-q m15-s">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e41-e6 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e7 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Required degree
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e8 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               The applicant must hold at least a B.Sc. degree (or equivalent) in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related program. At the time of application preliminary transcripts are accepted. Final transcripts must be provided upon enrollment.
              </p>
              <p>
               The grade average of the previous study should prove high qualification of the applicant. This will normally be the case for a grade average of ‘B’ or better in terms of the ECTS grading scale.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e9 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e10 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 English language
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e11 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               Applicants need to prove that they have sufficient fluency in English. We normally ask for IELTS 6.5 overall with at least 6.0 in each competency. This corresponds to a TOEFL iBT result with a score of about 95 out of 120. For information on accepted English language tests, please visit
               <a href="https://www.southampton.ac.uk/studentadmin/admissions/admissions-policies/language.page">
                https://www.southampton.ac.uk/studentadmin/admissions/admissions-policies/language.page
               </a>
              </p>
              <p>
               The proof of English proficiency is required even when the language of instruction for the previous education was English. However, for nationals of countries listed under this link the proof of language proficiency is waived.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e12 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e13 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Graduate Record Examination (GRE)
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e14 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               Taking the GRE test is recommended but not mandatory. The GRE code number of the University of Kaiserslautern is 7143.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e15 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e16 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Motivation letter
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e17 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               The applicant must show that he/she is well motivated for the Embedded Computing Systems programme by writing a short letter of motivation of about one page.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e18 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e19 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Recomendation letters
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e20 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               The application must be supported by two letters of recommendation from university professors or employers.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e21 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e22 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Further documents
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e23 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              For more details about the application process and required documents please visit Apply Now.
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>

               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Application form
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e119 m15-26 m15-27 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2c">
              <p>
               In order to apply for EMECS you need to create an account and fill your appli­cation in our online appli­cation platform. You can also apply for a scholar­ship on the same application platform. No separate scholar­ship application is needed.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Along with the appli­cation form the following documents must be provided:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e41-e120 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-18">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e41-e121 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e122 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e123 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e124 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e125 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Personal details
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e126 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e127 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e128 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e129 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e130 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Curriculum Vitae
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e131 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e132 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e133 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e134 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e135 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Proof of nationality (copy of passport). Candidates with multiple nationalities should decide at application stage under which nationality they are applying
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e136 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e137 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e138 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e139 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e140 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Copy of university degree(s) e.g. Bachelor/Master degree certificate (if available at the time of application, otherwise it needs to be presented upon enrollment)
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e141 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e142 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e143 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e144 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e145 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Transcript of Records (stating which courses were taken and what grades were obtained at the time of application)
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e146 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e147 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e148 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e149 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e150 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Translation of certificates and transcript of records (only if originals are not in English)
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e151 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e152 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e153 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e154 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e155 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Motivation letter
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e156 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e157 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e158 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e159 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e160 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Two recommendation letters from faculty staff or your employer (at least one should be from a faculty staff)
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e161 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e162 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e163 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e164 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e165 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Proof of English Proficiency (e.g., IELTS) using a scanned copy of result sheet. The proof of English language proficiency is waived, however, for nationals of these countries.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e166 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e167 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e168 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e169 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e170 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   GRE results (scanned copy of result sheet). Recommended but not mandatory
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e171 m15-27 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2c m15-2d">
              <p>
               The TOEFL code number of TU Kaiserslautern is
               <strong>
                7967
               </strong>
               . The GRE code number of the TU Kaiserslautern is
               <strong>
                7143
               </strong>
               .
               <br/>
               <br/>
               All documents are submitted electronically. However, the original documents and final certificates will be requested by the academic authorities before enrollment.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e172 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e173 m15-26 m15-27 m15-29 m15-2c m15-2e">
              <p>
               Our online application platform is closed.
               <br>
                The application deadline for the Fall intake 24/25 was January 31, 2024.
               </br>
              </p>
             </div>

               <div class="x-text-content-text">

                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e179 m15-26 m15-27 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2c">
              <p>
               All applications will be assessed by the EMECS selection committee. The selection will be based on the student’s profile and qualifications:
              </p>
             </div>

             <ul class="x-row e41-e223 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-1a">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e41-e224 m15-1p m15-1s m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x m15-1y">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e225 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e226 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">

                <div class="x-div e41-e227 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e228 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   All applications have to be done online through the EMECS appli­cation platform. The platform will open again in
                   <strong>
                    October.
                   </strong>
                   News and updates on the appli­cation will get announced here. Only complete online appli­cations are eligible and can be assessed.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e229 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e230 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e231 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">

                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e233 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Selection results for all applicants will be announced via email in
                   <strong>
                    May.
                   </strong>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e234 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e235 m15-2h m15-2i">

                <div class="x-div e41-e237 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e238 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Selected applicants have to confirm their acceptance
                   <strong>
                    within one week
                   </strong>
                   after receipt of selection result by sending the signed Declaration of Acceptance.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e239 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e240 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e241 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">

                <div class="x-div e41-e242 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e243 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Visa application should be started
                   <strong>
                    as soon as
                   </strong>
                   you receive your admission letter.  Don’t forget that 2 to 3 months are usually necessary to obtain a visa for Europe.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e244 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e245 m15-2h m15-2i">

                <div class="x-div e41-e247 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e248 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Applicants selected for EMECS, who only submitted
                   <strong>
                    preliminary
                   </strong>
                   certificates have to provide their final degree certificate upon enrollment.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e249 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">

                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e253 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Candidates selected for EMECS will have to bring all submitted and requested documents in original upon enrollment.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e254 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">

                   <strong>
                    one month
                   </strong>
                   after declaring their acceptance.
                  </p>

          <div class="x-row x-container max width e41-e270 m15-a m15-b m15-c m15-d m15-f m15-g m15-h m15-k m15-q m15-1e">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e41-e271 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e272 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 What does an EMECS Erasmus Mundus scholarship cover?
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e273 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               The student scholarship for the EMECS programme includes:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e41-e274 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-1f">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e41-e275 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e276 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e277 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e278 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e279 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   A scholarship tuition waiver: this covers the costs for programme tuition plus health insurance
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e280 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e281 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e282 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e283 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e284 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   A monthly living allowance amounting to 1,000 EUR for the entire duration of the EMECS programme (24 months): this allowance is dedicated to covering your living costs while studying in EMECS
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e285 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e286 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e287 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e288 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e289 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   A contribution to travel and installation costs: this is meant to support your travel and settling at an EMECS location (e.g., flight airfare and visa fees).
                   <br/>
                   <br/>
                   The amount varies and is computed individually based on your country of residence.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e41-e290 m15-a m15-b m15-c m15-d m15-f m15-g m15-h m15-k m15-q m15-1g">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e41-e291 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e292 m15-27 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2c m15-2f">
              <p>
               Dear applicants,
              </p>
              <p>
               <span>
                besides the scholarships open to students from anywhere in the world, the EU also granted us scholarships for specific “target regions”. This is good news for students from those target countries from which we normally do not receive many applications.
               </span>
               <span>
               </span>
              </p>
              <p>
               <span>
                If you come from the following countries, feel especially encouraged to apply:
               </span>
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e41-e293 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-1h">
              <div class="x-row-inner">

                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e297 m15-2i m15-2j">

                   Wester Balkan: Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, Montenegro
                  </span>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e299 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e300 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e301 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e302 m15-2i m15-2j">

                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e307 m15-2i m15-2j">

                   Asia Least Developed Countries: Afghanistan Bangladesh, Bhutan Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar, Nepal
                  </span>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e309 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e310 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e311 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e312 m15-2i m15-2j">

         <div class="x-section e41-e319 m15-0 m15-1 m15-2 m15-6" id="financialmatters">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e41-e320 m15-a m15-b m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-f m15-g m15-h m15-q m15-1i">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e41-e321 m15-1p m15-1q m15-1r m15-1s m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e322 m15-1z m15-20 m15-21 m15-22">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Financial matters
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e41-e323 m15-a m15-b m15-c m15-d m15-f m15-g m15-h m15-k m15-q m15-1j">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e41-e324 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e325 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Tuition fees
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e326 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               Details of tuition fees are as follows:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e41-e327 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-1k">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e41-e328 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e329 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e330 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e331 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e332 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   European students are charged 4.000 € per year (8.000 € in total).
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e333 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e334 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e335 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e336 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e337 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Non-European students are charged 8.000 € per year (16.000 € in total).
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e338 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2d">
              <p>
               Tuition fees only cover administrative fees and the academic costs of the programme. It does not include costs for living, housing and travel. Tuition fees should be paid in
               <strong>
                full
               </strong>
               before enrolling in studies. Note that all prospective EMECS students can apply for scholarships. Scholarship details can be found here.The scholarship is the same for EU and non-EU students.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e41-e339 m15-a m15-b m15-c m15-d m15-f m15-g m15-h m15-k m15-q m15-1l">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e41-e340 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e341 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Living costs in Kaiserslautern
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e342 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               The monthly cost of living for an unaccompanied individual in Kaiserslautern is estimated at 600 €/month. The city offers a high standard of living at a very reasonable cost. Depending on your life style the monthly costs can be estimated as follows:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e41-e343 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-1m">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e41-e344 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e345 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e346 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e347 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e348 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Accommodation: ~ 230 €
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e349 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e350 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e351 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e352 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e353 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Health insurance: ~ 80 €
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e354 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e355 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e356 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e357 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e358 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Food: ~ 190 €
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e359 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e360 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e361 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e362 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e363 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Clothing: ~ 50 €
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e364 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e365 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e366 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e367 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e368 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Leisure time: ~ 50 €
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e369 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e370 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e371 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e372 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e373 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Internet & phone: ~ 25 €
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e374 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2d">
              <p>
               Your student visa will allow you to work up to 20 hours per week during term time. Part time work can provide you with extra money but it shouldn't interfere with your studies. Many students work as Wissenschaftliche Hilfskraft (HiWi) for the university or nearby research centres. You can expect a compensation of approx. 350 €/month for working 8 hours/week as a HiWi.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e375 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e376 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Living costs in Southampton
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e377 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               If you are unaccompanied, the cost of living is usually between £7.200 and £8.800 per academic year (about 670 £ monthly). This should cover accommodation, food and meals, daily travel in Southampton, books, stationery, dissertation preparation and other items. Some courses may require an extra expense for material, use of laboratory equipment and final project. Depending on your life style the monthly costs can be estimated as follows:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e41-e378 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-1n">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e41-e379 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e380 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e381 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e382 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e383 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Accommodation: ~ 320 £
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e384 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e385 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e386 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e387 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e388 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Health insurance: ~80 €
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e389 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e390 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e391 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e392 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e393 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Food: ~180 £
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e394 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e395 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e396 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e397 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e398 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Clothing: ~ 40 £
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e399 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e400 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e401 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e402 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e403 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Leisure time: ~ 50 £
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e404 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e405 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e406 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e407 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e408 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Internet & phone: ~ 30 £
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e409 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2d">
              <p>
               Your student visa will allow you to work up to 20 hours per week during term time. Part time work can provide you with extra money for leisure activities but it should not interfere with your studies. The temporary job agency, called the
               <a href="https://www.southampton.ac.uk/hr/services/uniworkforce/index.page" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                ”Temp Bank“
               </a>
               , offers part time temporary positions at the University.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e410 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e411 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Living costs in Trondheim
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e412 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               There’s no escaping the reality: living in Norway is expensive. What follows are some descriptions of what you can expect in terms of expenses while you are a student here.
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e41-e413 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-1o">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e41-e414 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e415 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e416 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e417 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e418 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Housing: this is going to be your single biggest expense. Even a modest room in someone’s basement can cost NOK 3.000 (about 345 €) a month – and that may not include Internet, heat or electricity. Plan on roughly NOK 4.000 (about 460 €) a month for housing, more if you want more space.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e419 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e420 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e421 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e422 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e423 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Food: another high cost item, food in Norway is generally quite expensive. Plan on about NOK 2.400 (about 280 €) a month, or about NOK 600 a week. Depending on where you come from, this may sound like a lot, but it's not – not in Norway, anyway.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e424 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e425 m15-2h m15-2i">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e41-e426 m15-2k" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e41-e427 m15-2i m15-2j">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e41-e428 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2b">
                  <p>
                   Transport: this can be quite variable, but you should plan on at least NOK 500 a month. A 30-day pass on the bus system, AtB, costs NOK 390. There are other options available, listed on the bus webpages. For travel a little farther afield, you can use a regional bus system, Nor-Way, or the national train system, NSB. If you book your train in advance you can get a heavily reduced fare called a minipris.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e429 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2d">
              <p>
               A non-European student may work part-time for up to 20 hours per week when a work permit is granted. An application for a work permit should usually be accom­panied by a statement from the university confirming that the work will not affect the study progress. A letter from the employer stating that the student has a job offer should also be submitted. Students are normally allowed to work full time during semester breaks. Please note that the university doesn’t have an on-campus student work schemes, and foreign students will have to compete on the regular job market.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e430 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e431 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Living costs in Torino
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e432 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               Considering accommodation, food, telephone, local travel and leisure costs, you should plan on a monthly budget of EUR 600–EUR 800. More Information on living costs in Torino can be found
               <a href="https://international.polito.it/practical_information/cost_of_living" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                here
               </a>
               .
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

    <div class="x-main full" role="main">
     <article class="post-67 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail" id="post-67">
      <div class="entry-wrap">
       <div class="entry-content content">
        <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
         <div class="x-section e67-e1 m1v-0">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e67-e2 m1v-1 m1v-2 m1v-3 m1v-4 m1v-7 m1v-8">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e67-e3 m1v-e m1v-f m1v-g">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e67-e4 m1v-i m1v-j">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Curriculum and degree
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e67-e5 m1v-1 m1v-2 m1v-5 m1v-7 m1v-9">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e67-e6 m1v-g">
             <div class="x-text x-content e67-e7 m1v-l m1v-m m1v-n">
              <p>
               EMECS is a two-years master’s program. A total of 120 ECTS (European Credit Transfer and Accumulations System) credit points must be acquired. The curriculum consists of a core program, an elective program and a Master’s Thesis. The core program covers the fundamentals of embedded computing systems and offers an equivalent education in all four institutions. The elective program reflects the specific profiles of the participating partner universities and their associated research institutes.
              </p>
             </div>
             <span class="x-image e67-e8 m1v-q">
              <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="152" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/curriculum.jpg" width="432"/>
             </span>
             <div class="x-text x-content e67-e9 m1v-l m1v-m m1v-n">
              <p>
               All EMECS students who have successfully completed the curriculum will
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e67-e10 m1v-1 m1v-3 m1v-6 m1v-a m1v-b">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e67-e11 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e12 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e13 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e14 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e15 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   have a profound understanding of the scientific underpinning of the Embedded System field
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e16 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e17 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e18 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e19 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e20 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   be familiar with state-of-the-art architectures of hardware and software systems and how these architectures have different characteristics in different application domains and Embedded Systems ecosystems
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e21 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e22 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e23 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e24 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e25 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   have competences in creating new architectures for hardware and for system software (operating systems), including new and evolving architectures for Embedded Intelligence
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e26 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e27 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e28 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e29 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e30 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   be familiar with design methodologies for Embedded Systems
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e31 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e32 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e33 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e34 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e35 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   have knowledge of design models, languages and techniques for all levels of the design process of Embedded Systems
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e36 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e37 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e38 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e39 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e40 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   be familiar with the requirements of dependability and security for Embedded Systems and how these requirements are addressed at different levels of the design process
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e41 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e42 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e43 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e44 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e45 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   have practical skills in the development of embedded software
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e46 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e47 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e48 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e49 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e50 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   have practical skills in using state-of-the-art computer-aided methods and tools for hardware design, test and verification
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e51 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e52 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e53 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e54 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e55 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   have hands-on experience in industry-related embedded systems projects.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e67-e56 m1v-g">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e67-e57 m1v-i m1v-k">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Degree
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e67-e58 m1v-l m1v-m m1v-n">
              <p>
               Master of Science (M.Sc.) in Embedded Computing Systems (Joint Degree or Double Degree)
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e67-e59 m1v-g">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e67-e60 m1v-i m1v-k">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Core Program (45 ECTS)
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e67-e61 m1v-l m1v-m m1v-n">
              <p>
               The core program consists of three study areas:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e67-e62 m1v-1 m1v-3 m1v-6 m1v-a m1v-c">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e67-e63 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e64 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e65 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e66 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e67 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   Embedded System Hardware Architectures
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e68 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e69 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e70 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e71 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e72 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   System Software
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e73 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e74 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e75 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e76 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e77 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   System-on-Chip (SoC) Design Methodology
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <div class="x-text x-content e67-e78 m1v-m m1v-n m1v-p">
              <p>
               The four partner universities have agreed on the contents of these core study areas. All teaching modules of the core program are mandatory to all students and need to be finished within the first year of study at one of the partner universities. The core program guarantees that all students can achieve an equivalent educational level regarding the basic principles of embedded system design and architecture. After completion of the core program, no matter at which partner institution, students will be able to take full profit of the elective program and project activities offered throughout the consortium.
               <br/>
               <br/>
              </p>
              <p>
               More information:
               <a href="https://modhb.uni-kl.de/mhb/FB-EIT/cos-566/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                TUK
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/plans#programmeCode=MSECS" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                NTNU
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="https://www.southampton.ac.uk/courses/european-masters-in-embedded-computing-systems-masters-msc#modules" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                UoS
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="https://didattica.polito.it/pls/portal30/sviluppo.offerta_formativa_2019.vis?p_a_acc=2023&p_sdu=37&p_cds=18" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                POLITO
               </a>
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e67-e79 m1v-g">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e67-e80 m1v-i m1v-k">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Elective Program (45 ECTS)
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e67-e81 m1v-l m1v-m m1v-n">
              <p>
               The elective program consists of five study areas:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e67-e82 m1v-1 m1v-3 m1v-6 m1v-a m1v-d">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e67-e83 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e84 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e85 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e86 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e87 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   Advanced Topics in Embedded Systems
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e88 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e89 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e90 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e91 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e92 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   Communication & Signal Processing
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e93 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e94 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e95 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e96 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e97 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   Automation & Control
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e98 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e99 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e100 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e101 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e102 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   Microsys­tems
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e67-e103 m1v-e m1v-g m1v-h">
                <figure class="x-div e67-e104 m1v-r m1v-s">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e67-e105 m1v-u" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e67-e106 m1v-s m1v-t">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e67-e107 m1v-n m1v-o">
                  <p>
                   Artificial Intelligence
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <div class="x-text x-content e67-e108 m1v-m m1v-n m1v-p">
              <p>
               These areas are offered by all partner universities. Each partner university contributes a number of teaching modules to each elective study area. The teaching modules within an elective study area are varying between universities and reflect specific local strengths, special application areas, design methodologies and architectures of embedded systems.
               <br/>
               <br/>
              </p>
              <p>
               There are no mandatory teaching modules in the elective program. Every student is assigned a supervisor at each of the two partner universities that he or she attends. Based on the elective program an individual study plan is elaborated and mutually agreed on between the student and the supervisors.
               <br/>
               <br/>
              </p>
              <p>
               More information:
               <a href="https://modhb.uni-kl.de/mhb/FB-EIT/cos-566/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                TUK

              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Master’s Thesis (30 ECTS)
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e67-e111 m1v-l m1v-m m1v-n">
              <p>
               The last part of the curriculum during the second year of study is dedicated to a Master’s thesis. A thesis topic can be chosen at any partner institution of the consortium. The Master’s thesis is typically embedded into larger research projects conducted by the local research centres or together with industry. The topic and location of the Master's thesis is determined during the second year of studies.

              </p>

              </div>
             </ul>
             <div class="x-text x-content e73-e54 m21-10 m21-12 m21-14">
              <p>
               Our graduates find employment in a wide range of companies belonging to these industrial sectors.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e73-e55 m21-t">
             <div class="x-text x-content e73-e56 m21-10 m21-12 m21-14">
              <p>
               Embedded Systems design usually involves teams with a large number of engineers that have a wide range of competences and skills. Embedded Systems engineers often coordinate large design projects and lead the communication between different engineering groups. Our graduates are equipped with the competences necessary to take over responsibilities in collaborative projects involving hardware architects and designers, system engineers, system software architects, application software developers, specialists in design methodologies, verification experts, quality assurance experts, safety and security experts and project management.  The positions that our alumni have pursued both in academia and industry provide an evidence of the excellent teaching and research quality that our programme provides.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
