          <div class="x-row x-container max width e75-e2 m23-1 m23-2 m23-4 m23-5">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e75-e3 m23-7 m23-8">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e75-e4 m23-9">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Student mobility
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e75-e5 m23-1 m23-3 m23-4 m23-6">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e75-e6 m23-8">
             <div class="x-text x-content e75-e7 m23-a">
              <p>
               Graduation requires acquiring a total of 120 ECTS. Every student spends an academic year, two consecutive semesters, at two institutions of the consortium and earns 60 ECTS credits (or more) at each institution. If wished by the student, the consortium frequently supports a third mobility phase during the second year to conduct a master's thesis anywhere in the consortium.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Due to the binding definition of a core program no formal restrictions exist regarding the possible choices and the order of institutions within the consortium. This choice will only be influenced by the individual student's interest and partner profiles. An exception exists, however, for students from the consortium partner countries, Germany, Italy, Norway and the United Kingdom.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Students who have received their last degree in one of the consortium partner countries cannot receive a scholarship for studying EMECS in the same country. They must spend at least two study periods in two of the other partner countries. For example, a student who has received a bachelor's degree in Norway can receive a scholarship if he/she pursues the EMECS program at University of Southampton and University of Kaiserslautern.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e75-e8 m23-8">
             <div class="x-text x-content e75-e9 m23-a">
              <p>
               Applicants can express their mobility preferences in the application form. The consortium will attempt to respect these wishes but may also have to make adjustments for a balanced distribution of students. Each mobility stage will start with an orientation phase that includes a language course in Germany and Norway.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Students choosing mobility between partners TUK, NTNU and UoS will receive a joint degree issued by all three partner universities. The consortium is currently extended to the new partner POLITO. Students including POLITO into their mobility scheme will receive a double degree from POLITO and a second EMECS university, as chosen by the student's mobility path.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </article>

     <article class="post-77 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail" id="post-77">
      <div class="entry-wrap">
       <div class="entry-content content">
        <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
         <div class="x-section e77-e1 m25-0">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e77-e2 m25-1 m25-2 m25-3 m25-6 m25-7">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e77-e3 m25-e m25-f m25-g">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e77-e4 m25-i m25-j">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Rich international experience
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e77-e5 m25-1 m25-2 m25-4 m25-6 m25-8">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e77-e6 m25-g">
             <div class="x-text x-content e77-e7 m25-l m25-m m25-n">
              <p>
               International cross-cultural experience is key to success in today’s job markets. It is imperative to be ”globally ready“ to compete in a constantly changing world economy. By having studied in different countries you prove to employers that you are capable of coping with change and that you can perform effectively in an international setting. Additionally, working as a summer intern can give you better access to the work culture and job opportunities in each country.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               TUK, NTNU and Polito offer language courses in German, Norwegian and Italian, respectively. These courses are a great way to expand your horizon and to learn more about the culture of your host countries. Additionally, student bodies at our partner universities regularly organize interesting trips to renowned touristic destinations. We highlight in the following some of the popular student trip destinations at our partner universities.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e77-e8 m25-1 m25-2 m25-4 m25-6 m25-9">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e77-e9 m25-g">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e77-e10 m25-i m25-k">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Kaiserslautern
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e77-e11 m25-1 m25-3 m25-5 m25-a m25-b">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e77-e12 m25-e m25-g m25-h">
                <figure class="x-div e77-e13 m25-q m25-r">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e77-e14 m25-t" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e77-e15 m25-r m25-s">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e77-e16 m25-n m25-o">
                  <p>
                   Surrounding cities like Saarbrücken, Heidelberg, and Karlsruhe.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e77-e17 m25-e m25-g m25-h">
                <figure class="x-div e77-e18 m25-q m25-r">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e77-e19 m25-t" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e77-e20 m25-r m25-s">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e77-e21 m25-n m25-o">
                  <p>
                   Frankfurt and its international airport are about 115 km from Kaiserslautern.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e77-e22 m25-e m25-g m25-h">
                <figure class="x-div e77-e23 m25-q m25-r">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e77-e24 m25-t" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e77-e25 m25-r m25-s">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e77-e26 m25-n m25-o">
                  <p>
                   Paris which can be reached in 2,5 hours in a direct train from Kaiserslautern.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e77-e27 m25-e m25-g m25-h">
                <figure class="x-div e77-e28 m25-q m25-r">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e77-e29 m25-t" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e77-e30 m25-r m25-s">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e77-e31 m25-n m25-o">
                  <p>
                   The city of Strasbourg which is around 150 km from Kaiserslautern.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <span class="x-image e77-e32 m25-u">

             </span>
             <div class="x-text x-content e77-e33 m25-l m25-m m25-n">
              <p>

              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e77-e34 m25-g">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e77-e35 m25-i m25-k">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">

                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e77-e36 m25-1 m25-3 m25-5 m25-a m25-c">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e77-e37 m25-e m25-g m25-h">

                <div class="x-div e77-e40 m25-r m25-s">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e77-e41 m25-n m25-o">
                  <p>

               <li class="x-col e77-e47 m25-e m25-g m25-h">

               <li class="x-col e77-e52 m25-e m25-g m25-h">

              </div>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e77-e61 m25-1 m25-3 m25-5 m25-a m25-d">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e77-e62 m25-e m25-g m25-h">
                <figure class="x-div e77-e63 m25-q m25-r">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e77-e64 m25-t" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e77-e65 m25-r m25-s">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e77-e66 m25-n m25-o">
                  <p>
                   Trolltonga is piece of rock jutting horizontally at a height of about 700 meters.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e77-e67 m25-e m25-g m25-h">
                <figure class="x-div e77-e68 m25-q m25-r">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e77-e69 m25-t" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e77-e70 m25-r m25-s">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e77-e71 m25-n m25-o">
                  <p>
                   Munkholmen a small island across the shore of Trondheim. It's a popular tourist attraction.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e77-e72 m25-e m25-g m25-h">
                <figure class="x-div e77-e73 m25-q m25-r">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e77-e74 m25-t" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e77-e75 m25-r m25-s">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e77-e76 m25-n m25-o">
                  <p>
                   Bymarka is Trondheim's main park and offers remarkable skiing and hiking possibilities.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <span class="x-image e77-e77 m25-u">
              <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="96" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/trolltunga.jpg" width="150"/>
             </span>
             <div class="x-text x-content e77-e78 m25-l m25-m m25-n">
              <p>
               Trolltonga, Norway.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e77-e79 m25-g">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e77-e80 m25-i m25-k">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Torino
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e77-e81 m25-m m25-n m25-p">
              <p>
               Turin is less big and chaotic than Milano or Roma. It is considered as a “green” city, thanks to its many parks, on the River Po banks you can find many historical rowing clubs. The 2006 Winter Olympic Games, have left a great heritage to the city thanks to the restoration and re­build­ing works of the Turin sport structures.
               <br>
                <br>
                 Moreover in 2015 Turin will be also the
                 <em>
                  Capitale Europea dello Sport
                 </em>
                 (European Capital of Sport). Turin culture is very important and attractive thanks to its new modern and interactive museums. Strolling around the streets you can really feel the Turin history: among its monu­ments you will find the most important heritage of
                 <em>
                  Risorgimento Italiano.
                 </em>
                 You can go shopping to the city centre or department stores, where there are a lot of international chains and boutiques of the most important local designers. The services are efficient, most people are friendly and generally speaking Turin is a modern city eager to get involved. We are near the
                 <em>
                  Langhe,
                 </em>
                 the
                 <em>
                  Alpi
                 </em>
                 mountains and the sea of Liguria: its convenient position makes it a strategic city where to live!
                </br>
               </br>
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

       <div class="entry-content content">
        <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
         <div class="x-section e79-e1 m27-0 m27-1 m27-2">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e79-e2 m27-5 m27-6 m27-7 m27-8 m27-c m27-d">

                </h1>

              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>

             <div class="x-text x-content e79-e7 m27-u m27-v">
              <p>
               The EMECS consortium combines the strengths of four leading European universities in the field of Embedded Systems. We have numerous research activities and we particpate in two European Networks of Excellence, namely,
               <a href="http://www.artist-embedded.org/artist/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                ARTIST2
               </a>
               and
               <a href="https://www.hipeac.net/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                HiPEAC
               </a>
               .
               <br/>
               <br/>
              </p>
              <p>
               Research collaborations include the following industrial partners:
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>

          <div class="x-row x-container max width e79-e16 m27-5 m27-6 m27-8 m27-9 m27-c m27-h">

               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Rheinland-Pfälzische Technische Universität Kaiserslautern-Landau
                 <br/>
                 Standort: Technische Universität  Kaiserslautern
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e79-e19 m27-u m27-v">
              <p>
               TU Kaiserslautern was founded in 1970 as the only technical university in the state of Rheinland-Pfalz. Despite its relative young age it has established itself as a center of research excellence and achieved top places in overall German rankings. It is recognized as one of the best universities in Germany to study Electrical & Computer Engineering. The university has many collaborative projects with industrial partners in Germany and Europe.
              </p>
              <p>
               The city is a center of innovation, the futuristic PRE-UNI-Park, a technology site with modern architecture spanning 70,000 m², constitutes the core of the Science Alliance, an excellent network of internationally-renowned research facilities and industries.
              </p>
              <p>
               On January 1, 2023, the Technical University of Kaiserslautern and the University of Landau merged to form the Rheinland-Pfälzische Technische Universität Kaiserslautern-Landau.
              </p>
              <p>
               Notable research institutions:
              </p>

                    Fraunhofer Institute for Experimental Software Engineering (IESE).
                   </a>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>

             <div class="x-text x-content e79-e43 m27-u m27-v">
              <p>

Also, it's one of the UK’s leading research-intense universities. Moreover, its School of Electronics and Computer Science is the biggest and strongest in the United Kingdom (The Institution of Engineering and Technology).
               <br/>

               Notable research institutions:

In partnership with SINTEF, NTNU is responsible for seven national research centres for eco-friendly energy.

              <p>
               For 160 years, the Politecnico di Torino has been one of the most prestigious public institutions at both the Inter­national and the Italian levels concerning education, research, technological transfer and services in all sectors of architecture and engineering.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Torino is considered the industrial capital of Italy and hosts head­quarters and/or research centers of many important companies, including FCA, Telecom Italia, Thales Alenia Space, Magneti Marelli, Alstom. The main site of the new Italian Institute for Artificial Intelligence is also located in Torino, as well as a major site of the Italian Institute of Technology (IIT).
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Politecnico di Torino hosts leading research groups working in the area of Embedded Systems design.
               <br/>

               Notable research institutions:

     <article class="post-43 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail" id="post-43">
      <div class="entry-wrap">
       <div class="entry-content content">
        <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
         <div class="x-section e43-e1 m17-0" id="studentlife">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e43-e2 m17-2 m17-3 m17-4 m17-5 m17-6 m17-7 m17-8 m17-g m17-h">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e43-e3 m17-w m17-x m17-y">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e43-e4 m17-10 m17-11 m17-12">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Student life
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e43-e5 m17-2 m17-3 m17-4 m17-6 m17-7 m17-8 m17-9 m17-g m17-i">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e43-e6 m17-y">
             <div class="x-text x-content e43-e7 m17-16 m17-17 m17-18">
              <p>
               We provide in the following sections key information about the life at each of the campuses of our partner universities. For more detailed information, please refer to the respective sections on the websites of our partner universities.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e43-e8 m17-2 m17-3 m17-4 m17-6 m17-7 m17-8 m17-9 m17-g m17-j">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e43-e9 m17-y" id="tuk">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e43-e10 m17-10 m17-13 m17-14">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 University of Kaiserslautern
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e43-e11 m17-16 m17-17 m17-18">
              <p>
               The topographic convergence of technology and nature makes Kaiserslautern both a vibrant urban center and a natural oasis. Blessed with favorable surroundings, getting in touch with nature is particularly easy in Kaiserslautern, where Germany's largest interlinked woodlands are at your doorstep.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Kaiserslautern is home to people from over 140 nations, contributing to a diverse and vibrant city life. As a global village, Kaiserslautern cultivates friendly relationships with numerous cities from European countries as well as bonds overseas to the USA and Japan. Most of the 100,000 inhabitants speak English which makes it easy to feel at ease soon.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Please follow the following links for more information on
               <a href="https://rptu.de/en/studies/campus-life/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                campus life
               </a>
               and the city of
               <a href="https://www.kaiserslautern.de/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                Kaiserslautern.
               </a>
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Introductory video:
              </p>

            <div class="x-col e43-e13 m17-y" id="uos">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e43-e14 m17-10 m17-13 m17-14">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 University of Southampton
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e43-e15 m17-16 m17-17 m17-18">
              <p>
               Southampton is the largest city in the county of Hampshire on the south cost of England. It has a population of around 250,000 people. Southampton is a major sea port and the closest city to
               <a href="https://www.newforestnpa.gov.uk/about-us/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                new forest.
               </a>
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The University is a friendly and welcoming place, and student life on campus is vibrant and dynamic. As part of a global community, you'll have opportunities to work, live and socialise with students from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Please follow the following links for more information on campus life and the city of
               <a href="https://visitsouthampton.co.uk/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                Southampton.
               </a>
               <br/>
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Introductory video:

                 University of Trondheim
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e43-e19 m17-16 m17-17 m17-18">
              <p>
               The city of Trondheim is more than one thousand years old. The majestic Nidarosdomen Cathedral, makes Trondheim Norway's foremost pilgrimage site. The city has more than 180,000 inhabi­tants. With one in six of its residents a university student, Trondheim can't help but be a hoppin' town. Whether your idea of a lively nightlife is a piano bar or a lighted ski trail – Trondheim has it all. It's no wonder that Trondheim is regularly voted as Norway's best university student town.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Please follow the following links for more information on
               <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/lifeandhousing/trondheim" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                campus life
               </a>
               and the city of
               <a href="https://www.trondheim.no/en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">

               </a>
               .

             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e43-e22 m17-10 m17-13 m17-14">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 University of Torino
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e43-e23 m17-17 m17-18 m17-19">
              <p>
               “Without Italy, Torino would be more or less the same. But without Torino, Italy would be very different.” (Umberto Eco)
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Why Turin? Studying in Turin is an excellent choice.
               <br/>
               This city have the most prestigious academic poles in Italy: the Università degli Studi has up to 70.000 students (and 600 years of history); according to the Censis statistic the Politecnico is the best engineering University in Italy.
               <br/>
               The Politecnico di Torino can be considered a Research University: its strength is the creation of a study, research and innovation network, thanks to its yearly 800 protocol of agreements with public and private companies or local organisations. Every year 32.000 students choose its courses, masters and graduate studies in engineering and architecture; 15% of University community students are international and the partnerships with other faculties are several in the world and they allow the achievement of a Double-degree program.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               <a href="https://www.polito.it/en/education/international-students" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                General Information
               </a>
               <br/>
               <a href="http://www.studyintorino.it" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                studyintorino.it
               </a>
               <br/>
               <a href="https://www.polito.it/en/education/international-students/exchange-students/admission-procedure/arrivalpolito" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                Your arrival @PoliTo
               </a>
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>

       <div class="entry-content content">
        <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
         <div class="x-row x-container max width e44-e1 m18-0 m18-1 m18-2 m18-3 m18-4 m18-5 m18-b m18-c">
          <div class="x-row-inner">

              </div>

            </div>

          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="x-section e44-e4 m18-12" id="distinguished-lectures">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e44-e5 m18-0 m18-1 m18-2 m18-3 m18-4 m18-5 m18-b m18-d">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e44-e6 m18-m m18-n m18-o m18-p m18-q m18-r">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e44-e7 m18-v m18-x m18-z m18-10">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Distinguished lecture series
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e44-e8 m18-0 m18-1 m18-2 m18-4 m18-5 m18-6 m18-b m18-e">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e44-e9 m18-q m18-r">
             <div class="x-text x-content e44-e10 m18-14 m18-15 m18-16 m18-17">
              <p>
               In this lecture series, speakers from around the world will share their views on advanced topics in embedded systems design with the EMECS students. They will provide insights on the academic and industrial landscape of this field in their home countries. For EMECS students who are interested in pursuing a career in those countries, the invited scholars can also be valuable contact points.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The speakers come from both industry and academia. Some lectures are organized as single talks embedded in an existing course, other lectures are setup as additional courses for earning ECTS credits within the elective program.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e44-e11 m18-q m18-r">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e44-e12 m18-v m18-y m18-11">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">

                <figure class="x-div e44-e15 m18-1b m18-1c m18-1d m18-1e m18-1f">

                   <span style="text-decoration: underline;">
                    <a href="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/embedded-systems-students-welcome">
                     Prof. Ricardo Baeza-Yates, Institute for Experiental AI Northeastern University, USA
                    </a>

          <div class="x-row x-container max width e44-e113 m18-0 m18-1 m18-2 m18-3 m18-4 m18-5 m18-b m18-i">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e44-e114 m18-m m18-n m18-o m18-p m18-q m18-r">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e44-e115 m18-v m18-w m18-x m18-y">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 EMECS-thon
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e44-e116 m18-0 m18-1 m18-5 m18-6 m18-8 m18-9 m18-b m18-j">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e44-e117 m18-q m18-r">
             <div class="x-text x-content e44-e118 m18-14 m18-15 m18-17 m18-19">
              <p>
               EMECS-thon is an embedded systems marathon that is organized by EMECS students. Participating teams have 48 hours to develop an embedded system project from scratch. The event is carried out simultaneously in the universities of the EMECS consortium as well as several other universities each year.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Participating teams consist of up to three students. Each team has the flexibility to choose a project topic of their own interest. The event takes place in the fully equipped laboratories of each university. In order to allow the participants to devote the maximum amount of time possible to their projects all meals are provided.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               For more information please check the
               <a href="https://emecsthon.eit.uni-kl.de" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                EMECSthon website
               </a>
               .
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>

                 </iframe>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

                <div class="x-acc-content">

For questions regarding general services in each country (e.g. visa, accommodation, living costs), please contact the local international offices. For questions regarding academic issues of the program, please contact the EMECS coordinator or the academic course advisors at each university. All contact details are provided here.

                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e9" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e9" id="panel-e45-e9" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 <p>
                  The tuition fees and other financial information are discussed here. The full amount has to be paid at the beginning of your studies. The tuition only covers the costs of participation in the academic program. It does not include the costs for living, boarding, housing ..etc. If you are granted an Erasmus+ scholarship of the European Commission then the tuition fees for the regular period of study (2 years) will be covered. Full details on the offered scholarships can be found
                  <a href="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/admission#scholarship">
                   here
                  </a>
                  .
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="e45-e10 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e10" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e10" id="tab-e45-e10" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  When can I apply for the EMECS program and a scholarship?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e10" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e10" id="panel-e45-e10" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 <p>
                  The program always starts in the fall semester. Your application has to be submitted usually by January of the same year of your first semester of study. The application platform to enter your applications usually opens 3 to 4 months before the deadline on January 31st. You can only apply through this application platform during the periods when it is open to receive applications.The scholarship application is done on the same application platform and is a part of your application to EMECS. More details can be found
                  <a href="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/admission#applynow">
                   here
                  </a>
                  .
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="e45-e11 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e11" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e11" id="tab-e45-e11" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  What happens after my application?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e11" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e11" id="panel-e45-e11" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 <p>
                  The EMECS consortium decides about all applicants who have applied with all necessary documents before the deadline. The EMECS coordinator informs you about your admission to the EMECS program.
                 </p>
                 <ul>
                  <li>
                   If you are not chosen for the program you will receive an email to inform you about that.
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   If you are chosen for the program, but not granted a scholarship, you will receive a letter of admission and the declaration of acceptance via email.
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   If you are awarded a scholarship you will receive a letter of award, a letter of admission & scholarship and the declaration of acceptance via email.
                  </li>
                 </ul>
                 <p>
                  After the consortium has made its selections the selection results are submitted to Brussels. The consortium needs to wait until Brussels confirms the selections and has granted the stipends. Then applicants will be informed. Typically this happens some time in April.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="e45-e12 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e12" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e12" id="tab-e45-e12" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  What should I do after I got an email of acceptance for the program?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e12" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e12" id="panel-e45-e12" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 You have to fill out and send back the signed declaration of acceptance to ISGS via email or fax within a mentioned timeframe (contact details are given on the document itself). After that the EMECS coordinator sends you the original letters of admission by postal mail. You need them for getting a visa, if you are non-EU student. Please be patient, in some countries the postal way takes a bit longer.
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 Then the international office from each university send you a welcome mail, and if necessary an additional document of your first study location for getting a visa. If you have questions about getting a visa, please contact the appropriate local international service center.
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="e45-e13 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e13" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e13" id="tab-e45-e13" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  How do I get a visa/residence permit?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e13" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e13" id="panel-e45-e13" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 <p>
                  European citizens do not need a visa when moving within the EU, non-European citizens generally do. Visa issues generally are under competence of national countries, and therefore there are no single regulations and requirements for all European countries. Thus, you will have to inform yourself on the regulations of both of the countries you want to pursue your studies in. Applications for a visa have to be done from your native country (visa for your first place of studies), or of a country you have the residence permit in (visa for your second place of studies).
                  <br>
                   <br>
                    Please note that visa issues
                    <strong>
                     demand time and attention,
                    </strong>
                    sometimes it may even take up to 6 months. Thus, we suggest that you apply for your visa as soon as you receive your letter of admission to the EMECS programme and the welcome mail.
                    <br/>
                    <br/>
                    Detailed information about getting a visa or residence permit for each country (Germany, Norway, U.K.) are available in the
                    <a href="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/extras/downloads">
                     downloads section
                    </a>
                    . If you have further questions about getting a visa, please contact the appropriate local international office.
                   </br>
                  </br>
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="e45-e14 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e14" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e14" id="tab-e45-e14" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  What are my next steps after getting the visa?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e14" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e14" id="panel-e45-e14" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 <p>
                  You have to organize your travel to Germany, Norway or U.K. by buying tickets for planes and trains ... etc. If you were not granted an EMECS scholarship you have to get a health insurance on your own. It would be good, if the insurance is valid for both of your chosen countries. Currently we collaborate with the following insurance company: Dr. Walter GmbH, Mrs. Claudia Reichstein, phone: +49 (0)2247 9194 734, email:
                  <a href="mailto:reichstein@dr-walter.com">
                   reichstein@dr-walter.com
                  </a>
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                  Further information about your next steps is included in the welcome mail you get from the local international office (arrival at your first place of studies, accommodation, registration for language course etc.) or can be found in our guidelines and information sheets here.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="e45-e15 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e15" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e15" id="tab-e45-e15" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  When do I have to arrive?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e15" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e15" id="panel-e45-e15" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 <p>
                  The time of arrival in your first location of studies varies from country to country because there are different mandatory and optional activities before the course of studies starts (e.g. orientation/language course).
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                  In general you have to arrive … (the exact dates are in your letter of admission):
                 </p>
                 <ul>
                  <li>
                   Arrival to Kaiserslautern, Germany should be planned in mid August.
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   Arrival to Torndheim, Norway should be planned in mid August.
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   Arrival to Southampton, U.K. should be planned in mid Spetember.
                  </li>
                 </ul>
                 <p>
                  You can find the academic calendar with the semester duration in the EMECS info leaflet
                  <a href="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/extras/downloads">
                   here
                  </a>
                  .
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="e45-e16 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e16" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e16" id="tab-e45-e16" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  What to do after I have arrived?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e16" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e16" id="panel-e45-e16" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 Detailed information for new students about arrivals & transport, accommodation etc. are presented in our “admission package” with guidelines, flyers, and information sheets here. After you have arrived the local international office sends you an email to come to their office, and sign the student contract and if appropriate the scholarship contract. Only if you sign the contracts you will get the total permission to study in the EMECS program, and get your scholarship amount
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>

           <div class="x-row-inner">

               </div>

          <div class="x-row x-container max width e45-e115 m19-2 m19-3 m19-4 m19-6 m19-7 m19-8 m19-c m19-u">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e45-e116 m19-x">
             <div class="x-acc e45-e117 m19-16" id="x-acc-e45-e117" role="tablist">
              <div class="e45-e118 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e118" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e118" id="tab-e45-e118" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  What is an appeal?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e118" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e118" id="panel-e45-e118" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 An appeal here is defined as a request for a review of the decision regarding the admission for the EMECS Program under the current application period taken by the EMECS Consortium.
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="e45-e119 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e119" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e119" id="tab-e45-e119" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  Who can appeal?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e119" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e119" id="panel-e45-e119" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 Applicants of the actual application period on base of the notification sent via email by the EMECS Consortium about the decision of the admission to the EMECS Program. Appeals may be considered where, for example, your application was unsuccessful. Please note that we cannot consider information that was not included in the original application.
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="e45-e120 x-acc-item">
               <button aria-controls="panel-e45-e120" aria-expanded="false" aria-selected="false" class="x-acc-header" data-x-toggle="collapse" data-x-toggleable="e45-e120" id="tab-e45-e120" role="tab" type="button">
                <span class="x-acc-header-content">
                 <span class="x-acc-header-indicator">
                  ▸
                 </span>
                 <span class="x-acc-header-text">
                  How can I appeal?
                 </span>
                </span>
               </button>
               <div aria-hidden="true" aria-labelledby="tab-e45-e120" class="x-collapsed" data-x-toggle-collapse="1" data-x-toggleable="e45-e120" id="panel-e45-e120" role="tabpanel">
                <div class="x-acc-content">
                 <p>
                  If you wish to appeal the decision made by EMECS Consortium in relation to your Erasmus+ Program application, please follow the appeal procedure below.
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                  Appeals may be made in writing by sending an email to the EMECS consortium, contact email address:
                  <a href="mailto:emecs@eit.uni-kl.de" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                   emecs@eit.uni-kl.de
                  </a>
                  , within 10 calendar days of the decision being communicated to you.
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                  Please summarize the nature of your appeal by pointing out your argumentation for requesting a review or the issues of feeling treated unfairly.
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                  We aim to reply fully to you with the appeal decision, in writing, within 10 working days of the acknowledgement. Appeals that are more complex may take longer to deal with. In these cases we will keep you updated on the progress of your appeal.
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                  Make sure to provide a correct e-mail address so that you can receive notifications on the status of your appeal.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>

     <article class="post-1139 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail" id="post-1139">
      <div class="entry-wrap">
       <div class="x-container max width">
        <header class="entry-header">
         <h1 class="entry-title">
          Dino Mehmedagić
         </h1>
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content content">
         <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
          <div class="x-section e1139-e1 mvn-0">
           <div class="x-row x-container max width e1139-e2 mvn-1 mvn-2 mvn-3 mvn-5 mvn-6">
            <div class="x-row-inner">
             <div class="x-col e1139-e3 mvn-9 mvn-a">
              <div class="x-text x-content e1139-e4 mvn-f">
               <h5>
                From Sarajevo via Trondheim to Kaiserslautern
               </h5>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-col e1139-e5 mvn-9 mvn-b">
              <div class="x-text x-content e1139-e6 mvn-f">
               <p>
                <span style="color: #808080;">
                 Unispectrum live - Julia Reichelt (
                </span>
                <span style="color: #808080;">
                 <a href="https://www.unispectrum.de/studieren/von-sarajewo-ueber-trondheim-nach-kaiserslautern" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                  <span style="text-decoration: underline;">
                   original article
                  </span>
                 </a>
                 )
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                </span>
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="x-row x-container max width e1139-e7 mvn-2 mvn-4 mvn-7">
            <div class="x-row-inner">
             <div class="x-col e1139-e8 mvn-9 mvn-b mvn-c mvn-d">
              <div class="x-text x-content e1139-e9 mvn-f">
               <p>
                Dino Mehmedagić comes from Bosnia-Herzegovina. The 26-year-old specialized in "Embedded Systems" during the course of his electrical engineering studies. After completing his bachelor's degree in Sarajevo, he found the perfect master's program for this: the European Master in Embedded Computing Systems (EMECS). The TU Kaiserslautern offers the two-year program together with three partner universities.
               </p>
               <p>
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-col e1139-e10 mvn-9 mvn-c mvn-e">
              <span class="x-image e1139-e11 mvn-g">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="306" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/Dino_Mehmedagic.jpg" width="570"/>
              </span>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="x-row x-container max width e1139-e12 mvn-1 mvn-2 mvn-5 mvn-8">
            <div class="x-row-inner">
             <div class="x-col e1139-e13 mvn-9 mvn-b">
              <div class="x-text x-content e1139-e14 mvn-f">
               <p>
               </p>
               <p>
                Embedded systems consist of hardware, software and an operating system. They can be found in cars or smart phones and transform classic manufacturing technology into a smart factory by processing data and controlling processes in complex technical environments. They are each designed to perform a specific task - in the same way that a watch serves as a timekeeping system.
               </p>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 Bachelor in Sarajevo
                 <br/>
                </strong>
                Dino Mehmedagić is now an expert in the world of embedded systems: "At the beginning of my studies, my focus was on teaching existing hardware to perform a function by means of programming. Later, I specialized in writing the code that drives the design of a future hardware."
               </p>
               <p>
                The path to his current qualification has taken him abroad. He completed his bachelor's degree at the International University of Sarajevo, a private university. There he got his first taste of international air, spending two semesters abroad in Turkey. "That broadened my horizons," he says looking back today.
               </p>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 Excellence Master's in Kaiserslautern
                 <br/>
                </strong>
                In his search for the right master's program, a friend gave him the tip to find out about the Erasmus Mundus programs. These excellence courses are offered jointly by several European universities. TUK is the lead institution for EMECS and cooperates with the Norwegian University of Science and Technology in Trondheim, the University of Southampton and the Politecnico di Torino.
                <br/>
                "If you are interested in embedded systems in all facets, EMECS is a great stepping stone," says the young Bosnian. "And I was even lucky enough to get one of the coveted scholarships, which provides me with basic funding." He spent the first academic year 2018/19 in Trondheim because he was curious about the far north. Afterwards, he came to Kaiserslautern and does not regret this step: "There is almost everything you need here. And it's very pleasant to live in because the city is down-to-earth and clearly laid out." He's also taken a liking to the campus - especially the hammocks in the greenery, which invite students to take breaks to relax.
               </p>
               <p>
                <br/>
                <strong>
                 Keeping an eye on secure hardware
                 <br/>
                </strong>
                During his scientific training at TUK, he discovered new fields of activity for himself: verifying embedded systems and systems-on-chip (SoC) with regard to functional security. This already happens in the development phase. In concrete terms, the aim is to prevent hacker attacks and data leaks at an early stage. This is essential, not least for particularly security-relevant technical applications, such as in medical technology or autonomous driving.
               </p>
               <p>
                <br/>
                <strong>
                 Staying at the TUK
                 <br/>
                </strong>
                Accordingly, Dino Mehmedagic wrote his master's thesis in the group of Prof. Dr. Wolfgang Kunz, who is EMECS program coordinator. The latter developed a special methodology called UPEC "Unique Program Execution Checking" to detect security vulnerabilities in hardware architectures. The initial focus was on confidentiality - that is, ensuring that sensitive data is kept safe. Starting from the basic concept, Dino Mehmedagic also explored the aspect of integrity and developed an adapted methodology. This makes it possible to ensure that potential attackers cannot alter the operation of an embedded system.
                <br/>
                Since he gathered many ideas in the course of his master's thesis on how the methodology can subsequently be refined and developed, he continued with a doctoral position in 2021. Thus, the young engineer will spend even more time in Kaiserslautern.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </article>
