                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 More Alumni Highlights
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e780-e5 mlo-2 mlo-3 mlo-5 mlo-7 mlo-9">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e780-e6 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e7 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e8 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-n">
               By choosing to study EMECS, I did not only get access to high quality technical and practical knowledge delivered by top European universities, but I also had the opportunity to reinvent myself, discover new cultures, make friends, learn different languages, socialize with passionate people and work within a research institute as an intern and for my thesis. For me, EMECS is not a only a master's programme. It is an end-to-end technical and personal life-changing journey.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e9 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e10 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="340" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/alexandru-cohal-e1624871303605.jpg" width="340"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e11 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e12 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Alexandru Cohal
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e13 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Romania
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course: 2016 – 2018
                 <br/>
                 Mobility NTNU and TUK
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e14 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e15 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e16 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-p">
               (…) the best part in Kaiserslautern and Southampton was the “industrial” know - how of the lecturers, the lectures were with good examples and one could learn  a lot just by being regular. For me personally, as I was more into the software part of the embedded systems, UOS had the bigger advantage as it had a state-of-the-art laboratory and more interesting and newer lab assignments.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               (…) I would recommend Kaiserslautern for the students that want to learn the theory better and Southampton if the student learns and remembers more by a "hands-on approach" instead of reading and solving problems on the paper. (…) The courses was prepared well but the labs prepared me best for the professional life. Having the opportunity to do the thesis at a company was the "icing on the cake" and gave me the first job offer even before finishing the course.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e17 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e18 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="94" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/marjan-krsteski-e1624871410720.jpg" width="94"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e19 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e20 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Marjan Krsteski
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e21 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: North Macedonia
                 <br>
                  EMECS Course 2014 – 2016
                  <br/>
                  Mobility TUK and UoS
                 </br>
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e22 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e23 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e24 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-q">
               EMECS is a truly unique program in the Embedded Systems world. With a top-notch staff among the different partner universities, the combination of a solid core and elective program and the enriching experience of attending two different top tier in the field universities, the master program really prepares the students in an all-round way, by proving the set of technical knowledge and soft skills needed in the ever growing technology job market or entrepreneur scene. The multi-cultural environment and the incredible life experience just adds more to the overall value of the program. EMECS really rounded my professional education and helped me to push forward my career goals, in addition to meeting some of the most amazing people on the road!
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e25 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e26 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="181" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/sebastian-lee-barrera-e1624872107968.jpg" width="181"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e27 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e28 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Sebastian Lee Barrera
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e29 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Mexico
                 <br>
                  EMECS Course 2016 – 2018
                  <br/>
                  Mobility TUK and UoS
                 </br>
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e30 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e31 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e32 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-r">
               EMECS changed my life. I couldn't have even imagined the true scale of
it. Universities and the quality of education are of the highest
quality. Cultural exchange that you get from these two years is
unimaginable. Network of friends and colleagues that you build is both
broad and diverse. All of it while having the support of Erasmus in
any life aspect, let it be your relocation or study queries. I would
do it again if only they allowed me to!
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e33 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e34 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="202" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/kirill-bykov-e1624872323618.jpg" width="202"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e35 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e36 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Kirill Bykov
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e37 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Kazakhstan
                 <br>
                  EMECS Course 2017 – 2019
                  <br/>
                  Mobility UoS and TUK
                 </br>
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e38 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e39 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e40 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-s">
               EMECS helped me widen my mindset and grow both personally and professionally. There is the outstanding technical knowledge and valuable experience that you get while being in contact with experts in the different fields of embedded systems. In addition, you also develop soft skills by interacting and working together with people from all around the world. You get to be more curious and more prone to make questions and look for answers, to be more research-oriented and find rationales. Definitively EMECS is an excellent and complete master program.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e41 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e42 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="167" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/carlos-e1624872752963.jpg" width="167"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e43 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e44 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Carlos Calvillo Cortés
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e45 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Mexico
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2010 – 2012
                 <br/>
                 Mobility UoS and TUK
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e46 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e47 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e48 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-t">
               EMECS is in my opinion one of the best programs you can enrol into. All three partner universities are highly reputed and among the bests in Europe – participants are offered wide range of courses, labs and tools in the field of embedded systems allowing you to focus on your preferred area. Living in multi-cultural European cities, and getting to know and share experience with other peers from all over the world will certainly widen your horizon. Needless to mention, the amazing time you will have while getting the opportunity to develop needed skills set and knowledge for your future endeavours.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e49 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e50 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="150" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/mahboob-e1624873127210.jpg" width="150"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e51 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e52 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Usama Mahboob
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e53 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Bandgladesh
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2010 – 2012
                 <br/>
                 Mobility UoS and TUK
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e54 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e55 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e56 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-u">
               The demand for qualified embedded systems engineers already outstrips the supply. This skill gap is expected to rapidly increase with the advent of 5G technologies and the phenomenal growth of the Internet of things. The EMECS masters program is designed to qualify you with the right skills for the market of tomorrow. What I found unique about this program is that it offers a lot of study modules across different universities, which gives you the flexibility to specialize according to your ambitions and career goals. Furthermore, experiencing life in two different European countries will ultimately widen your options as to where you want to continue your future journey. Simply put, it is a highly recommended learning experience.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e57 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e58 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="350" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/ammar_ben-khadra.jpg" width="350"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e59 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e60 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Ammar Ben Khadra
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e61 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Morocco
                 <br>
                  EMECS Course 2011 – 2013
                  <br/>
                  Mobility UoS and TUK
                 </br>
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e62 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e63 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e64 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-r">
               I’ll answer the “why EMECS” question with a three-fold definition. From the academic side, EMECS is a chance to get educated in -and receive a joint master degree from- three European universities with expertise on different subcategories in embedded systems. From the social side, EMECS is a hand-picked group of students with a sense of group identity and motivation enough to organize their own international embedded systems hackathon (check out emecs-thon.org). And finally, as part of my life experience, nothing is the same after experiencing life in different European cities as a student.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e65 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e66 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="167" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/yaman-e1624873689197.jpg" width="167"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e67 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e68 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Yaman Umuroglu
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e69 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Turkey
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2011 – 2013
                 <br/>
                 Mobility NTNU and UoS
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e70 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e71 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e72 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-s">
               EMECS is a high quality, very challenging and relevant program for anyone interested in Embedded Systems. You get education in cutting edge technology, together with the experience of sharing with many brilliant and different people. You basically get the whole package!
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e73 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e74 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="167" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/torruella-e1624873906648.jpg" width="167"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e75 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e76 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Pedro Torruella
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e77 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Spain
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2010 – 2012
                 <br/>
                 Mobility UoS and TUK
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e78 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e79 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e80 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-t">
               EMECS is a unique program in the field of embedded systems that has allowed me to take my career to a whole new level where opportunities are endless. Compared to other programs in embedded systems, EMECS gives you the opportunity to be part of two of the top universities in Europe which allows you to take advantage of all the resources available, meet very talented people and expand your professional network.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e81 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e82 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="167" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/sergiozerpa-e1624878086879.jpg" width="167"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e83 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e84 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Sergio Zerpa
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e85 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Venezuela
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2012 – 2014
                 <br/>
                 Mobility TUK and UoS
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e86 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e87 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e88 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-u">
               Without a doubt, EMECS is one of the best decisions I have taken in my life. The program offers the oppor­tunity to study in two of the top European uni­versi­ties. The research and technical skills you learn throughout the master allow you to adapt yourself to the new challenges and techno­logies in a fast progressing field such as embedded systems. 

However, not everything is related to the academy. You also have the chance to meet wonderful and lovely people from all around the world. You get to know completely different cultures, traditions and places. As a result, the experience helps you grow,  not only as a professional, but also as a person.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e89 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e90 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="400" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/juan_felipe_vargas_colorado.jpg" width="400"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e91 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e92 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Juan Felipe Vargas Colorado
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e93 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Colombia
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2018 – 2020
                 <br/>
                 Mobility UoS and TUK
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e94 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e95 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e96 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-r">
               <p>
                It was a very good Experience, I met people from different cultures and countries. One thing I can't forget is that all my classmate were so friendly and loving. We could work as a team, have parties and travel. All the three Universities have both the best teaching facilities and professors. The programme is well structured with core courses and so many electives to choose from at all the three university. EMECS enabled me to get more knowledge and practical experience which has now enhanced my teaching and research experience. I am really grateful to coordinators of EMECS programme and European Commission for their financial support and encouragement. I hereby encourage my fellow Africans to apply for this programme.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e97 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e98 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="167" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/kawuma-e1624878374513.jpg" width="167"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e99 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e100 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Simon Kawuma
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e101 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Uganda
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2011 – 2013
                 <br/>
                 Mobility NTNU and UoS
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e102 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e103 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e104 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-s">
               <p>
                The experience in itself was full of adventures on both professional and personal fronts. Made new friends across the globe, Got a chance to test myself in two different education systems, traveled across half of Europe. This program was my first international experience and it truly was mesmerizing.
               </p>
               <p>
                The program is well structured both in terms of curricula and the expertise, that the consortium offers. The wide range of core research topics ranging from System On Chip Design, Microelectronics, Embedded Software, Real Time Systems enable you to find the right match for your interests. If you are best of the best and want to take your career a boost, EMECS is the program you should try to get into.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e105 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e106 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="167" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/awan-e1624884099628.jpg" width="167"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e107 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e108 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Ahsan Javed Awan
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e109 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: Pakistan
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2010 – 2012
                 <br/>
                 Mobility TUK and UoS
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e780-e110 mlo-d">
             <div class="x-div e780-e111 mlo-i mlo-j">
              <div class="x-text x-content e780-e112 mlo-l mlo-m mlo-t">
               I really enjoyed to be an EMECS student because of the very special link I developed with my peers. We were not just students who happened to attend the same courses, but a family. In the realm of foreign students, I have only observed that with Erasmus Mundus programs.
               <br/>
               I believe that EMECS is a great program, and any motivated student interested in embedded computing and system on chip could greatly benefit from it.
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-div e780-e113 mlo-i mlo-k">
              <span class="x-image e780-e114 mlo-v">
               <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="167" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/mayeul-e1625049402477.jpg" width="167"/>
              </span>
              <div class="x-div e780-e115 mlo-i mlo-j">
               <div class="x-text x-text-headline e780-e116 mlo-g mlo-h">
                <div class="x-text-content">
                 <div class="x-text-content-text">
                  <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                   Mayeul Marcadella
                  </h1>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="x-text x-content e780-e117 mlo-l mlo-o">
                <p>
                 Country: France
                 <br/>
                 EMECS Course 2012 – 2014
                 <br/>
                 Mobility UoS and NTNU
                </p>

     <article class="post-46 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail" id="post-46">
      <div class="entry-wrap">
       <div class="entry-content content">
        <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
         <div class="x-section e46-e1 m1a-0 m1a-1">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e46-e2 m1a-3 m1a-4 m1a-5 m1a-6 m1a-a m1a-b">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e46-e3 m1a-k m1a-l m1a-m">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e46-e4 m1a-o m1a-p">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 About
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e46-e5 m1a-3 m1a-4 m1a-6 m1a-7 m1a-a m1a-c">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e46-e6 m1a-m">
             <div class="x-text x-content e46-e7 m1a-r m1a-s m1a-t m1a-u m1a-v">
              <p>
               This Erasmus Mundus masters course on Embedded Computing Systems gives you the opportunity to study at institutions leading in this field and to experience European culture in two different countries.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The European Master's Course in Embedded Computing Systems (EMECS) is designed to educate bachelor's graduates from Electrical & Computer Engineering and Computer Science, Mathematics as well as graduates from related disciplines to become experts in the field of Embedded Computing Systems.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e46-e8 m1a-m">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e46-e9 m1a-o m1a-q">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Participating institutions
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e46-e10 m1a-3 m1a-5 m1a-8 m1a-d m1a-e">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e46-e11 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e12 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e13 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e14 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e15 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   <a href="https://rptu.de/en/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                    RPTU Kaiserslautern
                   </a>
                   , Kaiserslautern, Germany
                   <br>
                    <a href="https://eit.rptu.de/en/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                     Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering
                    </a>
                   </br>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e46-e16 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e17 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e18 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e19 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e20 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">

         <div class="x-section e46-e58 m1a-0 m1a-1">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e46-e59 m1a-3 m1a-4 m1a-6 m1a-7 m1a-a m1a-h">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e46-e60 m1a-m">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e46-e61 m1a-o m1a-q">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 EMECS — two-years Master’s course
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e46-e62 m1a-r m1a-s m1a-t m1a-u m1a-v">
              <p>
               EMECS is a two-years Master's course (120 ECTS credits) that is pursued at least at two out of the four participating institutions. Students will spend one or more semesters at each of the selected universities and will receive a joint degree or double degree from the respective institutions. The language of instruction is English. Students participating in this program will be trained in three major areas:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e46-e63 m1a-3 m1a-5 m1a-8 m1a-d m1a-i">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e46-e64 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e65 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e66 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e67 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e68 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   Hardware Architectures of Embedded Systems
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e46-e69 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e70 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e71 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e72 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e73 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   System-on-Chip Design
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e46-e74 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e75 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e76 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e77 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e78 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   System Software
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e46-e79 m1a-m">
             <span class="x-image e46-e80 m1a-1k m1a-1l m1a-1s">
              <img alt="Image" decoding="async" height="331" loading="lazy" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/index.png" width="572"/>
             </span>
             <div class="x-text x-content e46-e81 m1a-r m1a-s m1a-t m1a-u m1a-v">
              <p>
               These areas constitute the “Core Programme” of EMECS and will be taught during the first year of study at each institution. Completion of the core programme (45 ECTS credits) will ensure the mobility of the students after the first year of study.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The “Elective Programme” (45 ECTS credits) provides training in specialized topics of embedded system design and provides the background in typical application areas like communication systems, automation & control, microsystems and Artificial Intelligence. The course is completed with a Master's Thesis (30 ECTS credits) which typically contributes to a larger project conducted jointly with industry.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e46-e82 m1a-m">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e46-e83 m1a-o m1a-q">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Teaching outcomes
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e46-e84 m1a-r m1a-s m1a-t m1a-u m1a-v">
              <p>
               Students who have successfully completed the curriculum will:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e46-e85 m1a-3 m1a-5 m1a-8 m1a-d m1a-j">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e46-e86 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e87 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e88 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e89 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e90 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   be familiar with state-of-the-art architectures of hardware and software systems for embedded applications.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e46-e91 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e92 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e93 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e94 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e95 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   be familiar with design models, languages and techniques for all levels of the design process of embedded systems in heterogeneous applications.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e46-e96 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e97 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e98 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e99 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e100 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   have a profound understanding of the scientific underpinning of the embedded system field.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e46-e101 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e102 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e103 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e104 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e105 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   have practical skills in using state-of-the-art computer-aided design tools.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e46-e106 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e107 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e108 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e109 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e110 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   have hands-on experience in industry-related embedded systems projects.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e46-e111 m1a-k m1a-m m1a-n">
                <figure class="x-div e46-e112 m1a-10 m1a-11 m1a-12 m1a-13">
                 <i aria-hidden="true" class="x-icon e46-e113 m1a-17" data-x-icon-o="">
                 </i>
                </figure>
                <div class="x-div e46-e114 m1a-11 m1a-13 m1a-14 m1a-15">
                 <div class="x-text x-content e46-e115 m1a-t m1a-v m1a-w m1a-x">
                  <p>
                   have international team work experience, intercultural and multi-lingual communication skills needed to organize embedded system projects.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
              </div>
             </ul>
             <div class="x-text x-content e46-e116 m1a-s m1a-t m1a-u m1a-v m1a-z">
              <p>
               EMECS graduates can combine specialized expertise in selected areas of embedded computing systems with a global understanding of the entire system. Studying at universities in at least two European countries with different social, academic and economic environments gives them the opportunity to learn how to bridge cultural differences and to develop their communication skills. This is needed in both professional and social life.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The demand for graduates with these qualifications is high both in Europe and world-wide. EMECS graduates are highly sought after by employers in high-tech European companies being engaged in System-on-Chip design, telecommunication, automotive systems, manufacturing and beyond.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

       <div class="entry-wrap">
        <div class="x-container max width">
         <header class="entry-header">
          <h2 class="entry-title">
           <a href="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/news-and-events/european-master-in-embedded-computing-systems" title='Permalink to: "European Master in Embedded Computing Systems"'>
            European Master in Embedded Computing Systems
           </a>

           </a>
          </h2>
         </header>
         <div class="entry-featured">
          <a class="entry-thumb" href="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/news-and-events/application-status-corona-crisis" title='Permalink to: "Application status – corona crisis"'>
           <img alt="" class="attachment-entry-fullwidth size-entry-fullwidth wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="789" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1184px) 100vw, 1184px" src="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/martin-sanchez-Tzoe6VCvQYg-unsplash-scaled-1184x789.jpg" srcset="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/martin-sanchez-Tzoe6VCvQYg-unsplash-scaled-1184x789.jpg 1184w, https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/martin-sanchez-Tzoe6VCvQYg-unsplash-scaled-300x200.jpg 300w, https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/martin-sanchez-Tzoe6VCvQYg-unsplash-scaled-1024x683.jpg 1024w, https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/martin-sanchez-Tzoe6VCvQYg-unsplash-scaled-768x512.jpg 768w, https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/martin-sanchez-Tzoe6VCvQYg-unsplash-scaled-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/martin-sanchez-Tzoe6VCvQYg-unsplash-scaled-2048x1366.jpg 2048w, https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/martin-sanchez-Tzoe6VCvQYg-unsplash-scaled-100x67.jpg 100w" width="1184"/>

         </div>
         <div class="entry-content excerpt">
          <p>

     <article class="post-3 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail" id="post-3">
      <div class="entry-wrap">
       <div class="entry-content content">
        <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
         <div class="x-section e3-e1 m3-0 m3-1">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e3-e2 m3-3 m3-4 m3-6 m3-7">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e3-e3 m3-d m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e4 m3-f m3-g">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Privacy Policy
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e3-e5 m3-3 m3-5 m3-6 m3-8">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e3-e6 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e7 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 I. Scope
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e8 m3-i">
              <p>
               The following data protection declaration refers to the central web offer of www.rptu.de and other official websites of the RPTU Kaiserslautern-Landau, its organs and institutions. For contents of other providers, to which reference is made, for example, via links, other conditions than those described in this data protection declaration may apply.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e9 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e10 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 II. contact details of the responsible person
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e11 m3-i">
              <p>
               Responsible for the processing of your personal data is
               <br/>
               <br/>
               RPTU Kaiserslautern-Landau
               <br/>
               represented by the President
               <br/>
               Gottlieb-Daimler-Strasse, Building 47
               <br/>
               67663 Kaiserslautern
               <br/>
               Phone: +49 631 205 0
               <br/>
               e-mail: president(at)uni-kl.de
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e12 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e13 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 III. contact details of the data protection officer
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e14 m3-i">
              <p>
               You can reach our data protection officer by phone +49 631 205-4434 or by e-mail: datenschutz(at)uni-kl.de
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The postal address is:
               <br/>
               TU Kaiserslautern
               <br/>
               The Data Protection Officer
               <br/>
               PO Box 3049
               <br/>
               67653 Kaiserslautern
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e15 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e16 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 IV. Web Analysis
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e17 m3-i">
              <p>
               The TUK uses the open source software tool Matomo on its websites for statistical evaluation of the accesses, for error detection and to be able to improve our websites continuously. The following data is stored for this purpose:
              </p>
              <ul>
               <li>
                the anonymous IP address of the calling system
               </li>
               <li>
                Date and time of access
               </li>
               <li>
                the web page or file consulted
               </li>
               <li>
                the HTTP status code
               </li>
               <li>
                referencing website
               </li>
               <li>
                Subpages that are called up from the called up web page
               </li>
               <li>
                Frequency of the website visit
               </li>
               <li>
                the web browser used and the operating system
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p>
               This data is only stored on TUK servers. The data will not be passed on to third parties. Due to the anonymization of IP addresses, it is no longer possible to assign them to the calling computer.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The data is deleted as soon as it is no longer required for our analyses.
The software sets a cookie for 7 days on the user's computer in order to recognise returning visitors.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The legal basis for the collection and evaluation of this data is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. e in conjunction with Art. 6 para. 3 lit. b General Data Protection Regulation (DSGV) in connection with § Article 3 of the State Data Protection Act of Rhineland-Palatinate (LDSG).
If you do not agree with the storage and evaluation of this data, you can object to its storage and use at any time by clicking on the mouse. In this case a so-called opt-out cookie is stored in your browser, which means that Matomo does not collect any session data.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Your objection only remains effective if you do not delete the Matomo deactivation cookie on your computer. You will have to perform the opt-out again if you use another computer or another web browser.
If you have activated the "Do Not Track" setting in your browser, no opt-out is required.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e18 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e19 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 V. Contact forms and e-mail contact
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e20 m3-i">
              <p>
               On the TUK website there are contact forms which can be used for electronic contact. If a user takes advantage of this option, the data entered in the input mask will be transmitted to us and stored. Your consent is obtained for the processing of the data during the sending process and reference is made to this data protection declaration.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Alternatively, it is possible to contact us via the e-mail address provided. In this case, the user's personal data transmitted with the e-mail will be stored.
In this context, the data will not be passed on to third parties.
The legal basis for the processing of the data is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a DSGVO, if the user has given his consent.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The legal basis for the processing of data transmitted in the course of sending an e-mail is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f DSGVO. If the e-mail contact is aimed at the conclusion of a contract, the legal basis for this processing is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b DSGVO.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               This data is used exclusively for the processing of the conversation. The data will be deleted as soon as they are no longer required for the purpose of their collection. For the personal data from the input mask of the contact form and those sent by e-mail, this is the case when the respective conversation with the user has ended.
               <br/>
               The user has the possibility to revoke his consent to the processing of personal data at any time. If the user contacts us by e-mail, he can object to the storage of his personal data at any time. In such a case the conversation cannot be continued. You can revoke your consent and object to the storage via the contact form or by e-mail. All personal data stored in the course of the contact will be deleted in this case.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e21 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e22 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 VI. Cookies
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e23 m3-i">
              <p>
               When accessing individual pages, cookies may be used which are required for the functionality of our content management system (e.g. for password-protected pages and forms). Some elements of our website require that the calling browser can be identified even after a page change.
These technically necessary cookies are not used to create user profiles and are usually deleted after closing your browser.
You can deactivate or restrict the storage of cookies on your system by the settings in your Internet browser. Cookies already stored can be deleted at any time. If cookies for our website are deactivated or deleted, it is possible that not all functions of the website can be fully used.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e24 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e25 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 VII. provision of the website and creation of log files
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e26 m3-i">
              <p>
               Every time our website is accessed and used, data and information is automatically recorded in the log files of our servers. This collection is necessary to ensure proper operation, to detect errors and to identify attacks and malfunctions of our web offer.
The following data is collected during access (access logs):
              </p>
              <ul>
               <li>
                Date and time of access
               </li>
               <li>
                visited website
               </li>
               <li>
                referencing website
               </li>
               <li>
                Browser configuration
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p>
               The following data is collected in case of an error message (error logs):
              </p>
              <ul>
               <li>
                Date and time of access
               </li>
               <li>
                Nature of the error
               </li>
               <li>
                URL of the called web page and, if applicable, the referencing web page
               </li>
               <li>
                IP address of the user
               </li>
               <li>
                User name in the event of an authentication error for password-protected websites
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p>
               This data is not stored together with other personal data of the user.
The legal basis for the temporary storage of the data in the log files is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. e.V.m. Art. 6 para. 3 lit. b DSGVO in conjunction with § ARTICLE 3 LDSG.
               <br/>
               The error logs are used exclusively to identify and rectify technical faults.
The data will be deleted as soon as they are no longer required for the purpose of their collection. In the case of the collection of data for the purpose of providing the website, this is the case when the respective session has ended. In the case of storage of the data in log files, this is the case after seven days.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e27 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e28 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 VIII. General information on data processing
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e29 m3-i">
              <p>
               As a matter of principle, we process personal data of our users only to the extent necessary to provide a functional website and our contents and services.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Possible legal bases of the processing
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The legal basis is Art. 6 para. 1 letter a DSGVO, if the data processing of TUK is based on your consent as a data subject.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               When processing personal data which is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is a party, Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b DSGVO serves as the legal basis. This also applies to processing operations which are necessary to carry out pre-contractual measures.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Insofar as processing of personal data is necessary for the fulfilment of a legal obligation to which the TUK is subject, Art. 6 para. 1 sentence 1 lit. c in conjunction Art. 6 para. 3 lit. b DSGVO in conjunction with § 3 LDSG as legal basis.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               In the event that vital interests of the data subject or another natural person require the processing of personal data, Art. 6 para. 1 lit. d DSGVO serves as the legal basis.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               If the processing is necessary for the performance of a task of the TUK which is in the public interest or is carried out in the exercise of official authority, Art. 6 para. 1 lit. e in conjunction with Art. 6 para. 3 lit. b DSGVO in conjunction with § 3 LDSG as legal basis for the processing.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               If the processing is necessary to safeguard a legitimate interest of the TUK or a third party and the interests, fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject do not outweigh the former interest, Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f DSGVO serves as the legal basis for the processing; unless the TUK acts in a sovereign capacity in the processing in question.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               <strong>
                Recipients of personal data
               </strong>
               <br/>
               <br/>
               As a matter of principle, your personal data will not be passed on to other bodies or persons, unless required by law.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               <strong>
                Storage period
               </strong>
               <br/>
               <br/>
               The personal data will be stored until the processing is completed. They are deleted immediately when the stated purpose is achieved or the procedure concerned is completed and there is no obligation to archive them. Furthermore, data may be stored if this has been provided for by the European or national legislator in EU ordinances, laws or other regulations to which the person responsible is subject. Data will also be blocked or deleted if a storage period prescribed by the aforementioned standards expires.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e30 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e31 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 IX. Rights of the data subject
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e32 m3-i">
              <p>
               According to the DSGVO, every person affected by data processing has the following rights in particular:
              </p>
              <ul>
               <li>
                The right to information about the personal data stored about you and the processing thereof (Art. 15 DSGVO).
               </li>
               <li>
                The right to correction if the data concerning you is incorrect or incomplete (Art. 16 DSGVO).
               </li>
               <li>
                The right to have your personal data deleted, if one of the conditions according to Art. 17 DSGVO applies. However, the right to deletion under Art. 17 (1) and (2) DSGVO does not exist, among other things, if the processing of personal data is necessary to perform a task in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority (Art. 17 (3) b DSGVO).
               </li>
               <li>
                The right to restrict processing, in particular where the accuracy of the data is disputed, for the duration of the verification of its accuracy, if the data are processed unlawfully but the data subject requests that the processing be restricted instead of deleted, if the data subject needs the data in order to assert or exercise legal claims or to defend himself against such claims and the data cannot therefore be deleted, or if, in the event of an objection under Art. 21, it is not yet clear whether the legitimate interests of the controller outweigh those of the data subject (Art. 18 DS-GVO).
               </li>
               <li>
                The Right to object to the processing of personal data on personal grounds, unless there is an overriding public interest in processing which overweighs the interests, rights and freedoms of the data subject, or the processing is necessary for the assertion, exercise or defence of legal claims (Art. 21 DSGVO).
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p>
               <strong>
                Right of revocation in case of consent
               </strong>
               <br/>
               <br/>
               You have the right to revoke your consent at any time. The revocation is only effective for the future; i.e., the revocation does not affect the lawfulness of the processing carried out on the basis of the consent until the revocation.
               <p>
               </p>
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e33 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e34 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 X. Right of appeal to the supervisory authority
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e35 m3-i">
              <p>
               They have the right to complain to the State Commissioner for Data Protection and Freedom of Information of Rhineland-Palatinate if they believe that their personal data is being processed unlawfully by the TUK.
               <br>
                <br>
                 Postal address:
                 <br>
                  <br>
                   The Rhineland-Palatinate State Commissioner for Data Protection and Freedom of Information
                   <br>
                    P.O. Box 3040
                    <br>
                     55020 Mainz
                     <br>
                      Website:
                      <a href="https://www.datenschutz.rlp.de/de/startseite/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                       www.datenschutz.rlp.de
                      </a>
                     </br>
                    </br>
                   </br>
                  </br>
                 </br>
                </br>
               </br>
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e3-e36 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e37 m3-f m3-h">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 XI. Changes to the TUK Privacy Policy
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e38 m3-i">
              <p>
               In order to take into account current legal requirements and technical changes, as well as to implement our services and offers in a data protection-compliant manner, we reserve the right to update this data protection declaration regularly. The current status is January 2020.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="x-section e3-e39 m3-0 m3-2">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e3-e40 m3-3 m3-4 m3-6 m3-9">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e3-e41 m3-d m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e42 m3-f m3-g">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Right of Objection
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e3-e43 m3-3 m3-5 m3-6 m3-a">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e3-e44 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e45 m3-i">
              <p>
               You have the right to object to the collection of this anonymised user data. This will save or delete a Matomo deactivation cookie.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Your objection remains valid for as long as this Matomo deactivation cookie is stored on your computer. You will have to opt out again every time you use a different computer or a different web browser.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               These notes only apply to the web pages of the University of Kaiserslautern. External web pages from other providers that are linked on these pages may use data in a different manner than described in the above principles.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               You are not being tracked since your browser is reporting that you do not want to. This is a setting of your browser so you won’t be able to opt-in until you disable the “Do Not Track” feature.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="x-section e3-e46 m3-0 m3-2">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e3-e47 m3-3 m3-4 m3-6 m3-b">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e3-e48 m3-d m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e3-e49 m3-f m3-g">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Privacy Policy EU
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e3-e50 m3-3 m3-5 m3-6 m3-c">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e3-e51 m3-e">
             <div class="x-text x-content e3-e52 m3-i">
              <p>
               In order to apply for our programme the processing of personal data is necessary. Your data will only be held for evaluating your application and related administrative purposes. As selected EMECS candidate/applicant (proposed for a scholar­ship/fellow­ship, placed on the reserve list or joining on a self-paying basis) your data might get used for the purposes of evaluating the EMECS programme, efficiently manage the project, and producing statistics. Your data can be shared with the responsible EACEA, the European Commission, the European External Action Service staff, as well as to other stake­holders of the Erasmus+ programme, such as Erasmus+ National Agencies, National Erasmus+ Offices and the Erasmus Mundus Student and Alumni Association. Your data will not be shared with other third parties. Information relating to individuals (personal data) is collected and used in accordance with the Regulation (EC) No 45/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 December 2000 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data by the Community institutions and bodies and on the free movement of such data, OJ L8 of 12.1.2001, p. 1.
              </p>
              <p>
               By accepting this agreement, you allow the above-mentioned processing of your personal data. You can cancel this compliance at any time in writing or via email to EMECS programme adminis­tration. Non-encrypted data transfer through the Internet might enable unauthorized individuals to eavesdrop on your data.
               <br>
                The ”provisions for the processing of personal data“ in the context of the ”Erasmus Mundus Programme“ and ”Erasmus+ Programme“ of the Educational, Audiovisual and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA) can be found here (
                <a href="https://emecs.eit.uni-kl.de/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Privacy_statement_EMT.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                 here
                </a>
                )
               </br>
              </p>

     <article class="post-41 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail" id="post-41">
      <div class="entry-wrap">
       <div class="entry-content content">
        <div class="cs-content" id="cs-content">
         <div class="x-section e41-e1 m15-0 m15-1 m15-2 m15-3" id="requirements">
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e41-e2 m15-a m15-b m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-f m15-g m15-h m15-q m15-r">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e41-e3 m15-1p m15-1q m15-1r m15-1s m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e4 m15-1z m15-20 m15-21 m15-22">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Admission requirements
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="x-row x-container max width e41-e5 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-f m15-g m15-h m15-i m15-j m15-k m15-q m15-s">
           <div class="x-row-inner">
            <div class="x-col e41-e6 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e7 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Required degree
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e8 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               The applicant must hold at least a B.Sc. degree (or equivalent) in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related program. At the time of application preliminary transcripts are accepted. Final transcripts must be provided upon enrollment.
              </p>
              <p>
               The grade average of the previous study should prove high qualification of the applicant. This will normally be the case for a grade average of ‘B’ or better in terms of the ECTS grading scale.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e9 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e10 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 English language
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e11 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               Applicants need to prove that they have sufficient fluency in English. We normally ask for IELTS 6.5 overall with at least 6.0 in each competency. This corresponds to a TOEFL iBT result with a score of about 95 out of 120. For information on accepted English language tests, please visit
               <a href="https://www.southampton.ac.uk/studentadmin/admissions/admissions-policies/language.page">
                https://www.southampton.ac.uk/studentadmin/admissions/admissions-policies/language.page
               </a>
              </p>
              <p>
               The proof of English proficiency is required even when the language of instruction for the previous education was English. However, for nationals of countries listed under this link the proof of language proficiency is waived.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e12 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e13 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Graduate Record Examination (GRE)
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e14 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               Taking the GRE test is recommended but not mandatory. The GRE code number of the University of Kaiserslautern is 7143.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e15 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e16 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Motivation letter
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e17 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               The applicant must show that he/she is well motivated for the Embedded Computing Systems programme by writing a short letter of motivation of about one page.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e18 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e19 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Recomendation letters
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e20 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              <p>
               The application must be supported by two letters of recommendation from university professors or employers.
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="x-col e41-e21 m15-1t m15-1u">
             <div class="x-text x-text-headline e41-e22 m15-1z m15-23 m15-24">
              <div class="x-text-content">
               <div class="x-text-content-text">
                <h1 class="x-text-content-text-primary">
                 Further documents
                </h1>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e23 m15-26 m15-27 m15-28 m15-29 m15-2a">
              For more details about the application process and required documents please visit Apply Now.
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>

                </h1>
               </div>

             <div class="x-text x-content e41-e119 m15-26 m15-27 m15-29 m15-2a m15-2c">
              <p>
               In order to apply for EMECS you need to create an account and fill your appli­cation in our online appli­cation platform. You can also apply for a scholar­ship on the same application platform. No separate scholar­ship application is needed.
               <br/>
               <br/>
               Along with the appli­cation form the following documents must be provided:
              </p>
             </div>
             <ul class="x-row e41-e120 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-18">
              <div class="x-row-inner">

                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </li>
               <li class="x-col e41-e126 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">

                  </p>
                 </div>

                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>

                  </p>

                </div>

             <ul class="x-row e41-e223 m15-a m15-c m15-d m15-e m15-i m15-m m15-p m15-z m15-1a">
              <div class="x-row-inner">
               <li class="x-col e41-e224 m15-1p m15-1s m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x m15-1y">
                <figure class="x-div e41-e225 m15-2h m15-2i">

                   <strong>
                    October.
                   </strong>

                  </p>

               <li class="x-col e41-e234 m15-1p m15-1t m15-1u m15-1x">

                   </strong>

                </div>
